translate("Install Bibledit Cloud on CentOS")

translate("Follow the steps below to install Bibledit Cloud on CentOS 7 and 8.") translate("It needs basic knowledge about working with CentOS Server.")

  1. translate("Open a terminal.")

  2. translate("Update the software sources:")

    sudo yum update

  3. translate("For CentOS 7 install and activate a newer compiler:")

    sudo yum install centos-release-scl

    sudo yum install devtoolset-7-gcc-c++

    sudo scl enable devtoolset-7 bash

  4. translate("Install the software Bibledit relies on:")

    sudo yum install autoconf automake gcc gcc-c++ gcc-toolset-10-gcc-c++ libtool git zip unzip pkgconfig libcurl-devel openssl-devel curl make poppler-utils libxml2-devel

  5. translate("Download the most recent mimetic library from") http://www.codesink.org/download/mimetic-0.9.8.tar.gz.

  6. translate("Unpack the downloaded mimetic library:")

    tar xf mimetic-0.9.8.tar.gz

  7. translate("Change to the directory:")

    cd mimetic-0.9.8

  8. translate("Build and install the mimetic library:")

    ./configure --prefix=/usr

    make

    translate("This takes a while.") translate("There will be many technical messages and warnings, but there should be no errors.")

    sudo make install

  9. translate("Go back to the home directory:")

    cd

  10. translate("Download a recent version of Bibledit from") https://github.com/bibledit/cloud/releases.

  11. translate("Unpack the downloaded Bibledit in folder bibledit:")

    mkdir -p bibledit

    tar xf bibledit-5.0.9xx.tar.gz -C bibledit --strip-components=1

  12. translate("Change to the directory:")

    cd bibledit

  13. translate("Build Bibledit:")

    ./configure

    make

    translate("This takes a while.") translate("There will be many technical messages, but there should be no errors.")

  14. translate("For CentOS 7 deactivate the previously activated compiler:")

    exit

  15. translate("Open port 8080 in the firewall:")

    sudo firewall-cmd --zone=public --add-port=8080/tcp --permanent

    sudo firewall-cmd --reload

  16. translate("Start Bibledit:")

    ./bibledit &

  17. translate("Bibledit will be accessible through the IP address port 8080.") translate("Examples:")

    http://website.org:8080

    http://192.168.2.1:8080

    http://localhost:8080

  18. translate("Open the web address in the browser, follow the instructions on the screen to configure Bibledit Cloud, and log in.")

translate ("Most of Bibledit Cloud will now be working.") translate ("To get email services working, connect Bibledit to a gmail or other mail account.") translate ("To get SWORD resources working, install the SWORD libraries.") http://crosswire.org/sword/develop/index.jsp
